newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: SAfrica 96 inflation to average below 8 pct-finmin.
newsitem.headline: SAfrica 96 inflation to average below 8 pct-finmin.

text.p: South African Finance Minister Trevor Manuel said on Wednesday he expected average inflation to remain below eight percent this year.

Closing a three-day debate on the 1996/97 Appropriation Bill, Manuel also reiterated his assurance on Tuesday that the economy was on track to achieve the target of a 5.1 percent deficit in fiscal 1996/97.

"The macro-economic fundamentals are, in the main, sound. The economy is still on course for growth of more than three percent in 1996 and average inflation will, despite the depreciation of the currency, be contained below eight percent this year," he said.
South African July consumer price inflation -- data for which was released on Wednesday -- rose to 7.1 percent year-on-year from 6.9 percent in June.
Analysts expect it to peak at around nine percent towards the end of the year but still average under 7.5 percent in 1996, down from 8.7 percent in 1995.
